service:
You can use the Pricing Calculator API to programmatically create estimates for your planned cloud use. You can model usage and commitments such as Savings Plans and Reserved Instances, and generate estimated costs using your discounts and benefit sharing preferences.

The Pricing Calculator API provides the following endpoint:

  • https://bcm-pricing-calculator.us-east-1.api.aws

operations.BatchCreateBillScenarioCommitmentModific: Create Compute Savings Plans, EC2 Instance Savings Plans, or EC2 Reserved Instances commitments that you want to model in a Bill Scenario.
operations.BatchCreateBillScenarioUsageModification: Create Amazon Web Services service usage that you want to model in a Bill Scenario.
operations.BatchCreateWorkloadEstimateUsage: Create Amazon Web Services service usage that you want to model in a Workload Estimate.
operations.BatchDeleteBillScenarioCommitmentModific: Delete commitment that you have created in a Bill Scenario. You can only delete a commitment that you had added and cannot model deletion (or removal) of a existing commitment. If you want model deletion of an existing commitment, see the negate BillScenarioCommitmentModificationAction of BatchCreateBillScenarioCommitmentModification operation.
operations.BatchDeleteBillScenarioUsageModification: Delete usage that you have created in a Bill Scenario. You can only delete usage that you had added and cannot model deletion (or removal) of a existing usage. If you want model removal of an existing usage, see BatchUpdateBillScenarioUsageModification.
operations.BatchDeleteWorkloadEstimateUsage: Delete usage that you have created in a Workload estimate. You can only delete usage that you had added and cannot model deletion (or removal) of a existing usage. If you want model removal of an existing usage, see BatchUpdateWorkloadEstimateUsage.
operations.BatchUpdateBillScenarioCommitmentModific: Update a newly added or existing commitment. You can update the commitment group based on a commitment ID and a Bill scenario ID.
operations.BatchUpdateBillScenarioUsageModification: Update a newly added or existing usage lines. You can update the usage amounts, usage hour, and usage group based on a usage ID and a Bill scenario ID.
operations.BatchUpdateWorkloadEstimateUsage: Update a newly added or existing usage lines. You can update the usage amounts and usage group based on a usage ID and a Workload estimate ID.
operations.CreateBillEstimate: Create a Bill estimate from a Bill scenario. In the Bill scenario you can model usage addition, usage changes, and usage removal. You can also model commitment addition and commitment removal. After all changes in a Bill scenario is made satisfactorily, you can call this API with a Bill scenario ID to generate the Bill estimate. Bill estimate calculates the pre-tax cost for your consolidated billing family, incorporating all modeled usage and commitments alongside existing usage and commitments from your most recent completed anniversary bill, with any applicable discounts applied.
operations.CreateBillScenario: Creates a new bill scenario to model potential changes to Amazon Web Services usage and costs.
operations.CreateWorkloadEstimate: Creates a new workload estimate to model costs for a specific workload.
operations.GetBillEstimate: Retrieves details of a specific bill estimate.
operations.GetBillScenario: Retrieves details of a specific bill scenario.
operations.GetPreferences: Retrieves the current preferences for the Amazon Web Services Cost Explorer service.
operations.GetWorkloadEstimate: Retrieves details of a specific workload estimate.
operations.ListBillEstimateCommitments: Lists the commitments associated with a bill estimate.
operations.ListBillEstimateInputCommitmentModificat: Lists the input commitment modifications associated with a bill estimate.
operations.ListBillEstimateInputUsageModifications: Lists the input usage modifications associated with a bill estimate.
operations.ListBillEstimateLineItems: Lists the line items associated with a bill estimate.
operations.ListBillEstimates: Lists all bill estimates for the account.
operations.ListBillScenarioCommitmentModifications: Lists the commitment modifications associated with a bill scenario.
operations.ListBillScenarioUsageModifications: Lists the usage modifications associated with a bill scenario.
operations.ListBillScenarios: Lists all bill scenarios for the account.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists all tags associated with a specified resource.
operations.ListWorkloadEstimateUsage: Lists the usage associated with a workload estimate.
operations.ListWorkloadEstimates: Lists all workload estimates for the account.
operations.TagResource: Adds one or more tags to a specified resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes one or more tags from a specified resource.
operations.UpdatePreferences: Updates the preferences for the Amazon Web Services Cost Explorer service.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.ListBillEstimateCommitmentsResponse$item: The list of commitments associated with the bill estimate.

BillEstimateCommitmentSummary.base: Provides a summary of commitment-related information for a bill estimate.

BillEstimateCostSummary.base: Provides a summary of cost-related information for a bill estimate.

refs.CreateBillEstimateResponse$costSummary: Returns summary-level cost information once a Bill estimate is successfully generated. This summary includes: 1) the total cost difference, showing the pre-tax cost change for the consolidated billing family between the completed anniversary bill and the estimated bill, and 2) total cost differences per service, detailing the pre-tax cost of each service, comparing the completed anniversary bill to the estimated bill on a per-service basis.
refs.GetBillEstimateResponse$costSummary: A summary of the estimated costs.
refs.UpdateBillEstimateResponse$costSummary: A summary of the updated estimated costs.

refs.ListBillEstimateInputCommitmentModificat: The list of input commitment modifications associated with the bill estimate.

refs.ListBillEstimateLineItemsResponse$items: The list of line items associated with the bill estimate.

BillEstimateLineItemSummary.base: Provides a summary of a line item in a bill estimate.

refs.BillEstimateSummary$name: The name of the bill estimate.

refs.CreateBillEstimateResponse$name: The name of your newly created Bill estimate.
refs.GetBillEstimateResponse$name: The name of the retrieved bill estimate.
refs.UpdateBillEstimateRequest$name: The new name for the bill estimate.
refs.UpdateBillEstimateResponse$name: The updated name of the bill estimate.

refs.BillEstimateSummary$status: The current status of the bill estimate.
refs.CreateBillEstimateResponse$status: The status of your newly created Bill estimate. Bill estimate creation can take anywhere between 8 to 12 hours. The status will allow you to identify when the Bill estimate is complete or has failed.
refs.GetBillEstimateResponse$status: The current status of the bill estimate.
refs.UpdateBillEstimateResponse$status: The current status of the updated bill estimate.

refs.ListBillEstimatesResponse$items: The list of bill estimates for the account.

refs.GetBillEstimateResponse$billInterval: The time period covered by the bill estimate.

refs.UpdateBillEstimateResponse$billInterval: The time period covered by the updated bill estimate.
refs.UpdateBillScenarioResponse$billInterval: The time period covered by the updated bill scenario.

NegateReservedInstanceAction.base:
Represents an action to remove a Reserved Instance from a bill scenario.

This is the ID of an existing Reserved Instance in your account.

Represents an action to remove a Savings Plan from a bill scenario.

This is the ID of an existing Savings Plan in your account.

refs.CreateBillEstimateRequest$tags:
An optional list of tags to associate with the specified BillEstimate. You can use resource tags to control access to your BillEstimate using IAM policies. Each tag consists of a key and a value, and each key must be unique for the resource. The following restrictions apply to resource tags:

  • Although the maximum number of array members is 200, you can assign a maximum of 50 user-tags to one resource. The remaining are reserved for Amazon Web Services.

  • The maximum length of a key is 128 characters.

  • The maximum length of a value is 256 characters.

  • Keys and values can only contain alphanumeric characters, spaces, and any of the following: _.:/=+@-.

  • Keys and values are case sensitive.

  • Keys and values are trimmed for any leading or trailing whitespaces.

  • Don't use aws: as a prefix for your keys. This prefix is reserved for Amazon Web Services.
refs.CreateBillScenarioRequest$tags: The tags to apply to the bill scenario.
refs.CreateWorkloadEstimateRequest$tags: The tags to apply to the workload estimate.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: The list of tags associated with the specified resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: The tags to add to the resource.
